title: Twitter layoffs gutted election information teams days before midterms
description: Twitter has become one of America’s most influential platforms for spreading accurate voting information, but politicians, local officials and misinformation experts say Friday's layoffs have compromised that.

title: Elon Musk’s whirlwind first week at Twitter: 8,304 miles by private jet
description: Flight data shows the Gulfstream jet crisscrossing the country as Musk bounced around from meetings to parties.

title: Elon Musk’s Twitter layoffs, explained
description: As advertisers desert Twitter and former employees sue the company, here’s everything you need to know

title: Celestial second fiddle no more, China completes its space station
description: The completion of China's space station could cement Beijing's status as a celestial superpower -- and threaten U.S. dominance in space.

title: Every God of War game, ranked
Call of Duty made $800 million in one weekend. Here’s what that means.
description: In three days, "Call of Duty: Modern Warfare II" recorded $800 million in sales revenue, emphatically showing why gaming needs to be taken more seriously.

title: Elon Musk’s mass Twitter layoffs turn the page on a Silicon Valley era
description: Twitter was hailed for its welcoming and relaxed work environment. Elon Musk made it a relic of the past.

title: New workplace norms: Is it okay to quit via text, Slack or emaiI?
description: The pandemic created new communication habits at work, but has anything changed when it comes time to quit your job?

title: Heads up: Yet another Chinese rocket is falling back to Earth
description: The remains of the massive rocket, which carried the last module of a Chinese space station to orbit on Monday, is expected to plunge through the atmosphere, perhaps as soon as Friday.
